intro: Impatiens begoniifolia, commonly known as the begonia-leaved impatiens, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, velvety, ovate leaves that resemble those of begonias, hence its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of red, pink, and white, which bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Its foliage and flowers make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking vibrant, easy-to-care-for plants.
